creator: graham@reactivity.com
text:
Allow support for java web start using default configuration.

Add the following to web.xml

  <mime-mapping>
    <extension>jnlp</extension>
    <mime-type>application/x-java-jnlp-file</mime-type>
  </mime-mapping>

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
You must add it to your web.xml, otherwise it'll not work in other containers.
Tomcat should provide only a minimal set of mappings, that are likely to be
common to all containers. If you use anything except html, xml, or something
else that is very common, it's better to explicitely declare it. 

I'll try to find a source for "official" mappings ( RFC ??? ), but for now it's
much better for users to not rely on tomcat knowing too much about this and
define their own mappings. 

You can easily add a server.xml module to add mappings to MimeMap, if you have
to.
